With pray'rful palms close seal'd, 'God speed the axe!'" -Isabella Valencey Crawford, "Malcolm's Katie: A Love Story", Part I, _Old Spookses' Pass, Malcolm's Katie and Other Poems_. 1884.}} {{crawlquote|This weapon falls into the [[Axes]] category. It is a one handed weapon.}} The '''hand axe''' is a decent starting weapon. It is weaker than a [[mace]] or [[spear]] against single targets. But, like all axes, it allows the player to [[cleave]]. ==Strategy== Axes in general deal less damage than comparable options, but allow the user to cleave (hit multiple enemies). As a "simple" starting weapon, hand axes are good if you don't care about single-target performance. For example, [[minotaur]]s have the power to plow through the earlygame, whether they use a hand axe or a mace. Hand axes are the only axe with a [[minimum delay]] of 6 aut. Hand axes, in theory, are interesting with "flat" damage brands, like [[pain brand|pain]], [[electrocution]], or [[distortion]]. However, past the early game, you'll be losing too much damage compared to a [[broad axe]] of the same brand. {| class="prettytable" style="border:none; margin:auto; padding:0; text-align: center" ! || Image |- | '''Mundane''' || [[File:Hand axe1.png]] |- | '''Magical''' || [[File:Hand axe2.png]] |- | '''Artifact''' || [[File:Hand axe3.png]] |} ==History== *Prior to [[0.14]], hand axes could be thrown at enemies. That role was later filled by [[tomahawk]]s. {{weapons}} [[Category:Axes]]
